title.value: Паразито-хозяинные сообщества (гельминты - мышевидные грызуны) естественных и антропогенных ландшафтов Беларуси
Host-parasite communities (helminths - rodents) of natural and anthropogenic landscapes of Belarus

person.name: Shendrik, T.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). The Scientific and Practical Center for Bioresources

abstract.value: In course of the research there were studied the aspects of host-parasite community of natural and anthropogenic landscapes in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus. As a result of realized research there was presented the integral evaluation of the community structure of parasites and hosts, the regularities of change in the transformation of ecosystems, which were designed on the basis of principles of host-parasite communities in natural and man-made landscapes. Prioritized population density of hosts and biological features of the worms in the formation of component and composite host-parasite communities identified patterns of change in their spatial structure, depending on the intensity of the economic use of biocenosis. Variety of adaptive capacity in geo-and biohelminthes to changing environmental conditions due to anthropogenic transformation of biocenosis was identified. The environmental aspects of the relationship of worms and rodents, the role of different types of communication in a host-parasite system in maintaining of the strength of evriksen species of parasitic worms were studied. Patterns of change in host-parasite relationships in multi-type anthropogenic pressures on ecosystems were identified.
